textos_fuente.text: Three Birds Tavern owners to retire, owner of Annex 400 Beach to take over We use cookies to give you the best experience on our site. Learn more or close to accept. √ó Skip to content Stories Guides Events Visitors Tours Merch Stories Guides Events Visitors Tours Merch Search Search COMMUNITY PARTNER Burg Three Birds Tavern owners to retire, owner of Annex 400 Beach to take over October 12, 2021 ‚Ä¢ By Andrew Harlan October 12, 2021 ‚Ä¢ By Andrew Harlan 137 SHARES Facebook Twitter Three Birds Tavern is one of the most celebrated restaurants in St. Pete. Just one taste of the oh so sweet potato fries tossed in sea salt, honey cinnamon-bourbon butter¬†and you can taste why Three Birds is so beloved. Robin and Jack King, owners of Three Birds Tavern in St. Petersburg for more than twelve¬†years, are retiring and passing the nest along to local hospitality professionals John and¬†Haley Ruetz. We will miss the gregarious, charismatic, and assiduous Kings, but we are delighted they‚Äôre ready to take this well deserved step back. It‚Äôs encouraging to see a new pair of local entrepreneurs take up the mantle of this 4th Street gem. ADVERTISEMENT Let‚Äôs hope the Bread Pudding for Breakfast stays on the brunch menu because it is our favorite way to wake up on a Sunday ‚Äî especially on the outdoor patio. Three Birds Tavern restored a 140-year-old building Truly, Three Birds offers the best shaded outdoor dining in the Sunshine City. When the Kings moved to St. Petersburg in 2009 and bought the 140-year-old former farmhouse at 1492 Fourth Street North, their goal was to create a family-friendly neighborhood restaurant with fresh food, refreshing drinks, a welcoming environment for all and a strong¬†sense of community. Mission accomplished. The Kings restored the building and expanded the outdoor patios, all while preserving its old charm and beautiful towering oak trees.¬†The space is brimming with local history, and maybe a casual haunt or two. In 2015, their efforts to restore the building were recognized with a city beautification award. Robin and Jack share the belief that community always comes first. They are active advocates¬†of the buy local movement and Robin often mentors emerging female entrepreneurs. Both focus on supporting local artists, local nonprofits and fellow local business owners in all industries. Robin and Jack King join the Buy Local Movement In 2014, Robin started a second business, Out of the Weeds artisan sauces and, just two years later, was named Tampa Bay Business Woman of the Year in Hospitality. The restaurant has received numerous awards over the years, such as Best New Business, several ADDY Awards¬† for logo design, branding and website, Most Community-Minded Business, Best Established¬† Business, as well as many food awards, including TBBJ Best Dish in the Biz. ‚ÄúWhen we bought the building in 2009, Jack told me we would give this a 10-year run after his first retirement from a successful litigation career in Ohio, so I knew in 2019 our time was¬†winding down,‚Äù Robin said. But the Kings decided they would continue to operate Three Birds¬†Tavern until the perfect buyers came along. The problem, she shared, was that while many offers had been made for the building since a¬†developer first approached them in 2015, all of them had plans to tear the building down. ‚ÄúThat isn‚Äôt what we wanted for this little piece of St. Pete history,‚Äù Robin said. Two St. Pete locals take over the storied restaurant John and Haley, both born and raised here in the ‚ÄòBurg, are dedicated to preserving the property and making the¬† restaurant even better. John owns and operates The Annex on Beach Drive and prior to that¬†managed 400 Beach Seafood and Tap House and Cafe Gala at the Dali Museum. He and Haley just welcomed their second child. ‚ÄúWe are excited to carry on the tradition of Three Birds Tavern with our growing family (two future busboys) and be an active part in the community in which we live and love,‚Äù John said. Robin and Jack are grateful to the hundreds of team members who worked tirelessly over the¬†years, and especially through this pandemic. Robin and Jack are enormously grateful to the thousands of guests who supported the restaurant,¬†making 12 years of continued growth possible, and wish John and Haley much success. The Kings are ready to enjoy retirement In the future, you will find the Kings splitting their time between the beaches of Florida, the mountains of North Carolina and traveling the country to visit their adult children. They¬†especially look forward to spending more time with their 3-year-old granddaughter and new¬† grandson. Congrats, Robin and Jack. You both deserve it! Visit Three Birds‚Äô website , and Instagram for future updates. Email Stay in the know Andrew Harlan A proud Eckerd College graduate, he‚Äôs a passionate advocate for independent bookstores and St. Petersburg‚Äôs thriving craft coffee scene. When he‚Äôs not working, you‚Äôll find him biking the Pinellas Trail, strolling with his dogs, catching a film at Green Light Cinema, or enjoying long runs along the city‚Äôs award-winning waterfront parks. About Us - Three Birds Digital Skip to content Strategic Consulting & Planning Content Creation & Community Engagement Advertising, Analytics & Performance About Us Blog Contact Us Subscribe To Our Newsletter Toggle Menu Our story Three Birds Digital is a small business with BIG goals ‚Äì to help your business grow! Contact Us Today! Founded in 2023 by Libby White, Three Birds Digital emerged from a clear vision: to provide affordable, professional marketing services tailored to the unique needs of small to mid-sized businesses. Recognizing the challenges faced by these enterprises in a rapidly evolving digital landscape, Libby embarked on a mission to create a marketing agency that not only delivers exceptional results but also operates on principles that resonate deeply with its clientele. Contact Us Today! OUR VALUES At Three Birds Digital, we are guided by a core set of values that define who we are and how we operate. These principles are the bedrock of our approach to digital marketing, ensuring that every strategy we devise and every campaign we execute is infused with integrity, innovation, transparency, and a deep focus on our customers. Our commitment to these values is unwavering, as they inspire us to deliver exceptional results for businesses of all sizes. 01 Innovation At the heart of Three Birds Digital, innovation is more than a buzzword; it‚Äôs our operational blueprint. We believe in staying ahead of trends, continuously evolving our strategies, and employing cutting-edge technologies to keep our clients at the forefront of their industries. 02 Transparency We understand that trust is the cornerstone of any successful partnership. That‚Äôs why we prioritize clear, open communication with our clients. From strategy development to execution, we ensure that our clients are informed and involved every step of the way. 03 Integrity Conducting our business with the utmost integrity is non-negotiable. We are committed to ethical practices, honesty, and fairness in all our interactions. Our goal is to build long-term relationships based on mutual respect and ethical business practices. 04 Customer-Focused Our clients are at the center of everything we do. We are dedicated to understanding and addressing their unique needs, challenges, and aspirations. Our approach is not one-size-fits-all; instead, we tailor our services to deliver personalized solutions that drive growth and success. Event Calendar Submit an event Hurricane Alliance About Us Meet The Team Contact Us Advertising With TBBW Posher Palate Three Birds Tavern in St. Petersburg announces new owners October 12, 2021 | Jo-Lynn Brown Robin and Jack King, owners of Three Birds Tavern in St. Petersburg for more than twelve years, are retiring and selling the business to local hospitality professionals John and Haley Ruetz. Three Birds Tavern is housed in a 140-year-old, former farmhouse, at 1492 Fourth Street North. Robin and Jack King, owners of Three Birds Tavern The Kings purchased the property in 2009 and restored the building and expanded the outdoor patios. In 2015, Three Birds Tavern was recognized with a city beautification award. ‚ÄúWhen we bought the building in 2009, Jack told me we would give this a 10-year run after his first retirement from a successful litigation career in Ohio, so I knew in 2019 our time was winding down,‚Äù Robin said, in a statement. The Kings decided they would continue to operate Three Birds Tavern until the perfect buyers came along. John and Haley, St. Pete natives, say they are dedicated to preserving the property and making the restaurant even better. John owns and operates The Annex on Beach Drive and prior to that managed 400 Beach Seafood and Tap House and Cafe Gala at the Dali Museum. ‚ÄúWe are excited to carry on the tradition of Three Birds Tavern, with our growing family (two future busboys,) and be an active part in the community in which we live and love,‚Äù John said, in the statement.
